name: Moon Hunters
description: Play alone or with friends! A co-op personality test about exploring an ancient, occult world in 5 days. How will you be remembered?

recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 8.1 Processor: Quad Core CPU - 4GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Storage: 4 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Here is my review of Moon Hunters:  Pro:  `Great Storyline. It could be based on a actual old legend! `Multiple Characters to choose from (plus 2 hidden ones!) `Multiple Endings `Cooking! `Random Maps! Some maps are fixed, such as the 1st map the player starts on `Great Musical Score! `ARPG basically.. `Different skills per character you play!  Cons: `Repetitive once you beat it once. It can get boring doing it over and over again to get everything in the game `Some maps are fixed and are always the same event on them! `Getting Moon Opals(Money) is quite hard and must be farmed for!     Multiplayer is SO-SO online: Last time i played the game online with others there were some disconnection bugs..still it is quite fun to play. There are also some map bugs when you play online, but the game is pretty playable even when online...so yea, multiplayer online is fun. Don't be put off by these small hiccups though, you just need to friend someone on the forums here and invite them automatically into the game..it bypasses the lobby code on the game..  Anyway, the pro's outweight the cons in my personal opinion.

While its true moon Hunters Has alot of flaws, The campaign is short, It is pretty buggy, The combat is a little repetitive.   I have to say there really is something special about It that keeps me coming back. Sitting down with a couple people and just playing is loads of fun and engaging, and even if the campaign is short, It is meant to be that way, The game isnt quite a rogue like but it is meant to be played as one, you start over again when you finish carrying through only minimal things from before. but those things can make a difference. I do reccomend this game, but not as a solo or an online game. As a great couch coop game.

This game boasts procedural generation when in reality the effects it has on the game is minimal. This game is extremely bare bones and does not offer much replayability in regards to story and gameplay. I managed to play through the game 3 times in 100 minutes. I beat the final boss the second time and all I recieved was a different ending cutscene and a new map which doesn't add much gameplay wise. Gameplay consisted of either slowly picking off enemies using the same basic attacks while trying to avoid damage and running past everything trying to find the exit because I had no health.   The trait system is odd and seemed like a good idea but was underused. You get one or two traits early on depending on a vague choice and then if you are lucky you get the chance to use them. (I never did) Pros: -Great Soundtrack -Good Cutscenes -Character Design Cons: -Low replay value -Combat is meh -AI constantly gets stuck in place -Weird hitboxes on the enemies with frontal protection (you have to hit them from an angle? I think?) -Feels bare bones and underdeveloped  I was hyped for this game and am severly dissapointed. I'm sure this game could be great if they added more features and diversity in gameplay but until then ¯\_(ツ)_/¯  (Also people comparing this game to Zelda and Diablo are full of ♥♥♥♥ lmao)

I currently have 13h on the beta version of the game.  First of all : Even if it looks like an action packed Mana game serie, be aware that this game is about the journey, the seek and the poetry more than fighting (but there are fights if you like them, and in co-op, it will feel like a Gauntlet)   You are seeking for a goddess that you might or might not find and different things happens each time you play, even when you make mostly the same choice. 'Each time you play' means 'each time one of your character become a legend in 5 days and nights', which happens kinda fast to be honest.   So here it comes : the Main features :   - Rogue like concepts. - Fast, easy-to-learn-but-hard-to-master fighting system. You might die a lot, especially with the bard, but don't worry, it's part of the story to run away sometimes.  - NG+ mechanics A LOT. In most rogue like, you spend a lot of time in game but you rarely beat the final boss. Here it can happen really often, but even if you die against it, you'll unlock new features anyway.  - Poetry ! Songs and winds whispers are delightful !  - You didn't read dialogues in game since the old RPG era ? This game might make you actually read the dialogues again, and wanting to read it, which for me is incredible.   Conclusion : Blend Gauntlet with rogue like elements, put an extra 110% poetry and 'play again if you want to see what I have to offer' and you have a solid, original and enchanting game.   This game is like none other until now, and really has some fresh air for your face, so for me it's a solid 8 or 9 out of 10.

A nicely crafted story-driven action rpg. Character progression is driven by narrative decisions, a novel change that helps reinforce immersion. One playthrough is rather short, but luckily the game is designed for multiple playthroughs with character unlocks and randomly generated events. The music is absolutely phenomenal and the writing top-notch.
I've been following this game for a while, and I really, really wish I could fully recommend it.    The Good

There are a lot of things to like about Moon Hunters. The game is fun to play. If you like 2D action/adventure games, like Zelda or Diablo, I think you will have a lot of fun with the game. The controls are pretty simple but are responsive. The game works better as a co-op game but you can still have fun with the game in single player. Moon Hunters probably works best in group settings where some of the players aren't experienced gamers since the game is pretty easy overall.  The story is interesting and I like that every decision you make has an effect on gameplay as well as the ending. Each decision you make gives you stat boosts that help you in the game. When you finish the game you also get a little story about your journey telling the legend of your hero. This legend gives you details about what happened to your hero after your journey. Combine this with great music and good graphics and Moon Hunters creates an engaging environment.  The biggest problem with the game is that each game is quite short (30 minutes to one and a half hours). This means you will quickly start running into repeated material. While the worlds appear to be randomly generated, the events that you encounter start to repeat themselves quite a bit. A good example is that the final boss of the game seems to always be the same (unless I have yet to find events that change the final boss battle). While this doesn't ruin the game, it keeps it from being as good as it could have been.   If you like 2D action/adventure games you should enjoy Moon Hunters. If you want to fully explore the game's world you can get quite a bit out of the game. If you don't like to repeat a lot of material though you may not get as much out of the game as you were expecting.   Note: I received a review copy from the developers but received no other compensation for this review.    Read My Full Review   [www.geekyhobbies.com]

really beautiful game. I love the music and the watercolour paintings of the characters as they talk with you etc. Definitely the strongest part of the game. I don't love how repetitive it is though and a lot of the playthrough feels sort of aimless, like I'm not really sure what I'm supposed to be doing so I sort of just wander around until I die. I think if it were a little bit more clear what I'm supposed to accomplish beyond don't die and eventually beat the final boss, I would enjoy this game a lot more/not mind how repetitive it is. Still it is enjoyable to play and like I said already, beautifully made.

I have only played this game for a short amount of time, but I am enamored by the art-style and overall quality of such a light RPG. The cut scenes are beautifully illustrated and the dialogue articulate. The game is meant to be explored several times through, enabling the player to discover new and refreshing classes, skills, and areas. As a co-op team, it is much more thrilling. It is interesting and unique to see each player's choices and decisions in real time. While the game does not provide much background or lore in the beginning, the universe still feels deeply thoughtful and story-rich.  My only real critique of the game is the customization options. I am a left-handed gamer, and at the time of writing this review you are not able to rebind keys from WASD, which makes it more difficult for me to navigate versus the arrow keys.

Moon Hunters is a overall a fun and still updating game.   A visually appealing game for any fan of classics, and art.   The cooking system and the constellations have kept me coming back to play it through multiple times, as well as the changes to the story for each choice you make.   There are some cons, being there are a limited number of choices and you can get into the same ending pretty easily if not careful. But everytime you unlock something, you expand the amount of things to do next playthrough as well.   The soundtrack is one to remember and a pleasure to listen to.   I'd say $10 or below is a very fair deal and to buy it at such, if it's there.

Just from my initial experience with it, I think Moon Hunters rules a lot. Imagine Diablo synthesized with The Yawhg into a short-form, choose your own adventure/action game dealing with legend and mythology. The game has a fantastic art style and I've particularly enjoyed the music, which just so happens to have been done by the same duo behind The Yawhg's great soundtrack. Can't really say much else about it yet, but I'm really looking forward to playing the game co-op (locally too!) Highly recommended

PROS: If you're playing with your friends then this game is an amazing journey. It's kinda rougelike and very rewarding! It's always an adventure that lasts ~2 hours and it's always different from the journeys before.  The charakters you can play are very different and each has it's unique gameplay!!  CONS If you play the Online (beta) you can only play SOLO on each PC. Please make it possible to combine local + online coop!
I played through the game once so far, became a foolish, compassionate, vengeful brave blood witch with a snake friend, I will be remembered as a dragon forever.  11/10

Every month I host a PC couch co-op game with my console playing friends. Last night was Moon Hunters and it went over well. Even my wife played and she usually sticks to little shooter games like Duck Game when we play. Moon Hunters definitely has some good multiplayer mechanics and the length of the game is nice. Though my friends commented on how it would be nice to set up some custom options on the game, such as longer game length to be able to explore a bit further before the end. Either way, we have not unlocked everything in this game. It will definitely be coming out for another round on our next gaming night. Highly recommended as a couch co-op. I may try the online multiplayer at some date and I would not recommend this as a solo game.
One of the BEST GAMES EVER!!!!!

The game has interesting world concept and a great story to demonstrate its rogue-like design, also the art is splendid. but i won't recommend it for those who wants some smooth and funny combat like Into the Gungeon or Rogue Legacy, in other words, the combat system is just wrong: bad designing and bad balancing. But for those who just want to enjoy a good story in a beautiful world, you can difenitely give it a try.

I patiently waited almost 6 months for this game to be released, and was not disappointed.   The world is beautiful, the music is amazing, and the story is fantastic.  Definitely looking forward to many hours of fun playing this, thank you Kitfox for all your hard work!
Immersive and breathtaking

Great game for a group of friends. The gameplay is set up for different play styles and decision-making. A single game takes between 1-2 hours to complete so very easy to plan a group session. The gameplay and story encourages multiple playthroughs.  For such a graphically minimal game, the creators did an excellent job creating mood and scene through music. Beautiful soundtrack.   Gameplay is simple to pick up and battles reminiscent of old arcade games.
Incredible game. Has a very magical and pagan atmosphere to it. I'm enjoying it a lot and gameplay is great too, love how it's a roguelike with a good story and world!

I hate giving Moon Hunters a negative review, but after analizing the game in every aspect I was left with no other choice. I am not a kickstarter backer, but since I saw this game a year ago I was really excited and hyped, and waited patiently. Unfortunately this game lacks replay value. Sure, you unlock new things, such as events, cooking dishes and constellations, but that's all I can come up with. It feels incomplete, unpolished and pretty hollow.   No challenge, no story. The only motivation I get to replay it is to see what new events I can trigger, that is if im really lucky. I will hope that it gets patched regulary and polished because Moon Hunters has huge potential.  I dont know if its ok to mention other games, but It would be nice that the devs could play other roguelikes such as rogue legacy, risk of rain, faster than light, binding of isaac, darkest dungeon and many more, and see why they were succesful, and compare them to moon hunters. Im not saying the game should be similiar to those i mentioned, but to grasp what can moon hunters offer their users to make them keep playing, and surely constellations arent enought.  TL;DR: We need a more drastic change in gameplay in each play session.

Got to the final boss and instead of just straight up killing the boss we talk it out then I charmed and ran away with him.  Not sure what happend to my friend but it was a great time. ;) 10/10 IGN
single player is average finished in maybe a hour

it really is coop fun.  but Moon Hunters don't have alot of content and you can complete one playthought in less than a hour....  in my opinion its a good game but the price is waaaay to high, 5 bucks for a Coop pack (2x the game) would be a fair price.......
Gameplay is really shallow.
This game is beautiful in many ways. Soundtrack, an everchanging world, changes made by previous runs, and so much more. While not very well known Moon Hunters has captured my mind and soul.
Great couch co-op game but the network issues can kill the experiance. Picked it up for 9 bucks and say it was well worth it.

I backed Moon Hunters on Kickstarter in the first week it was announced. I really wanted to like Moon Hunters. I did not like Moon Hunters.  The visuals, music, and writing is good, but the game leaves a lot to be desired. Any form of a coherent plotline is absent, and lore is heavily lacking, even though this game claims itself to be all about 'myth-weaving.'  The combat is also bland and the most repetitive part of the game.
2hrs here, can't even play. Always crashing.

The concept? Great! The result? Bad The game is beautiful, the music, the art style... but after the 3rd time you play it, you start to realize the repetitive gameplay and mechanics. You'll feel more like taking random answers rather than really see how your choices change the world. the game is not optimized, so it will crash and have minor glitches that just keep and keep going on. The online multiplayer mode does NEVER work, doesn't matter how hard you try on any of the servers, it wont work and belive me, i've tried tons of times. Also, there's not really a challenge in the game, you know that everything will keep the same way until the 5th day, and there you can get an acceptable ending, or a boring one that'll make you wonder why you wasted your time. The combat is like super easy. The game does have potential, but it REALLY needs to be improved, don't buy it until it's on discount or free.
Multiplayer sucks.

Exactly the same problem for me as in the 'Stories: the path of destinies'. At first it's all exciting and stuff. But after playthrough 3-4 you've honestly seen like 90% of the game content and there is no point in playing anymore unless you're an achievement hungry nerdballer. Meh! More progression plz, or make gameplay more interesting.  Still brobably worth a buy if discount is good.
Beatiful smart game for lazy local co-op! Though definetly has problems with old controllers (some solved with x360ce).

Despite a few glitches and bugs at launch, the game is really enjoyable solo or in co-op. The music is really immersive and beautiful, the storytelling is really smart and often surprising. The game keeps changing the more you play it and you keep getting surpised by it. Must play.
Does not play at all the way it was presented, imo.

My only regret is that I didn't find the Kickstarter page in time to contribute.   The people at Kitfox Games captured me immediately with Moon Hunters' premise of building mythologies and their gorgeous color palettes and art style. When I looked deeper, I discovered that they planned to incorporate so many of the things my friends and I added to our experiences playing Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles, and I think SquareEnix would do well to look at this game if they ever want to try to create a true sequel to FFCC.  Launch was a bit rough with a few balancing issues, bugs, and the unexpected short-form play style, but Kitfox is engaged and attentive to their community and have worked since launch correcting and improving the game. I was so impressed with the results of their hard work that I decided to suggest a 'Practice Makes Perfect' Steam Award specifically for Kitfox and Moon Hunters. I suppose this means that my only other regret is that I cannot nominate Moon Hunters for every Steam Award.

For now i just did 2 playthroughs on the game and i really liked! it was really fun good for me who likes short roguelikes styles.  --Good-- Fun Gameplay  Good co-op *local at least*  Good stories Nice Characters and skills Great Pixel art  Good bosses *at least the 2 i faced*  Great Replayability Multiple Endings  --Bad-- A little repetitve Sometimes the bosses are really easy, specially the Final one *at least for now*  Lack of the translation of the free content *they said it's a wip already, i will change after they fix*  Not much variety on the basic attacks It's easier on co-op  in general it worth for me getting this game, cause i don't have much time to play and i always enjoy quick games like that. but if you looking for a big epic adventure, it's not the case. it's quick nice adventure to enjoy.   hope it gets more updates and keep improving the game =)  i will update the review the more i play.
The visuals are gorgeous and the gameplay semmingly endless. Each adventure is different thus making the idea of unlocking everything addictive. I absolutely adore this game!

Let me say that I really enjoy most of the aspects of this game. I like the art, the music, I like the gameplay for the most part, and I am really not even opposed to the idea that each playthrough is like 20 minutes. However, I played this game for like 5 hours and, as far as I can tell, completed a vast majority of the story lines and endings. There is a massive amount of room for improvement here, and it wouldnt be that hard to do it, but before I can say its worth the money, there has to be a very hefty amount of content added. If each story is supposed to be unique, why did I see the exact same content on nearly every playthrough?   I should mention that I only played the game solo, so, maybe I am missing out on a very important aspect.
No motivation to repeat playthrough. Screen Size locked to 1080p. Graphics looks bland and controls feel clunky.

I love this game! Been waiting since I first heared about it last year and it did not disapoint! A great little choose your own adventure with great art and an old school legend of zelda feel with great looking art and design. Although I wish they had even MORE hunters to choose from I am satisfied that each and every person can make their own unique hunter. I recommend this title!

Love the art style, the music, and the animations. I have yet to play some online multiplayer, but if it's as good as the single player, it'll be freaking awesome. 10/10 will spend many more hours playing it.

I really want to sing Moon hunters praises, The game does a more interesting take on Diablo-style hack-n-slash adventuring by adding in this neat little personality mechanic, that effects how your playthru will go, and what ending you get; giving the game high replayibility and the fact that it has local & online co-op is a huge plus. The character's playstyles are unique, and the story is pretty interesting.  However, after afew playthroughs, the gameplay becomes abit monotonous. Each area you go through follow a similiar pattern that after my 4th playthrough I wasnt having fun anymore just trying to see a different ending. Plus I never felt really challenged throughout the whole thing. Thats not a brag, I'm not MLG pro or anything, it just kinda felt I was skating by. And I felt the game did alot of telling rather than showing. For instance, some dudes asked me who I thought was hotter, I choose one, then at the end it informs me I made out with him??   I'd reccomend picking this game up if you wanna play a co-op adventure with friends. Espescially if it goes on sale. I just hope the developers build upon this game and release a more fully fleshed out sequal! Thanks you guys.

This game is beautful, the sound track is even more amazing, and the gameplay can go on forever. I have only played a few hours so far, but I feel like I have barely scratched the surface. This game is challenging at first, and incredibly fun with more players. Easy to play with controller or keyboard, but I recommend controller :)

This has to be one of the best game I've play in a whail. First off, the characters are awesome, all of them have very unique and awesome character designs. Plus there are many things to explore in the world. You can't just play through the game once, or twice, or even 20 time!

Great game, especially for couch multiplayer. Better controller compatability than most games too, supports PS4, 360, etc natively. Great art design & music, and an interesting setting too. Similar to the Yawhg, but with a gauntlet-style rogue-lite rpg. Very fun.

Maybe this game isn't for everybody, seeing as the metacritic score isn't great and all. That being said, I found myself completely enchanted after my first playthrough. I wasn't good, and my character ended up being garbage, but I had a great time. I played again, had a blast, and made a slightly better character. Yes, some playthroughs have the same events. Yeah, the challenge starts to fade once you figure out combat mechanics. But I really felt like each of my characters were unique and interesting, and that my paths were varied and compelling. Looking forward to future playthroughs, as well as seeing what the devs has in store for the future.

I'd give this game a solid 8.5/10.  Pros: - The roguelike elements ala groundhog day: that means that every action you take makes the game progress. Even dying all of the 5 days. Each playthrough digs deeper into the story and builds itself more complex and interesting. - The classes: interesting, plays well, pretty cool co-op, different story paths each character. - The art: gorgeous game. - Random events and environment shape your adventure. You start with one of the classes, map and levels are randomly generated with events, npcs or places that will affect the outcome of the playthrough. - Character skill customization: each character has upgradable that will affect attacks/spells/permanent. You need to buy them and think how you want to play it this playthrough.  To improve: - I feel the combat is a bit too rigid. But not by that much.  Cons:  - Ally AI: This game needs pathfinding. Tue summons and following allies always end being stuck somewhere every 5 seconds. - Boss difficulty: Every boss is really easy. There's always a ways to exploit them somehow. Not mucha challenge. - Bugs: I found a few innocent bugs here and there. Nothing gamebreaking.    I really enjoy this game.  Disclaimer: I read my review and devided to improve the score from 8/10 to 8.5/10. I felt that it lost half a point because I think it needs more DLC, and I don't think it's fair to remove half a point to something that needs to be more of itself. I rate the quality, not the quantity.  HOLY. I just tried the songweaver. Those mechanics are really interesting. Great idea.
